overview_of_class:
Thesis I is the first in a sequence of three courses (Thesis I-III) that center on creating a student's MFA thesis project, which can be either a 12-20 min. film OR an interactive/new media project. In Thesis I students will develop or refine their project ideas, develop a thesis proposal, and fully immerse themselves in the production phase of their projects. Students are expected to spend a significant amount of time outside of class producing their thesis projects, with footage and string-outs to be reviewed in class. At the end of Thesis I, they should be ready to start editing their projects.

In addition, to working on their projects, students will also learn about relevant production and post-production topics, view and discuss documentaries in class, provide feedback for other students' projects, and develop an artistic statement. Each student will develop a short presentation and written essay that critically analyzes a filmmaker's particular film or body of work and describes its relevance to the student's own work and approach to the medium.
